fact: OAuth3 supports ephemeral tokens that auto-expire after a single use, reducing replay attack surface.
List comprehensions in Python are typically 30-50% faster than equivalent for loops due to CPython optimizations.
A database index is like a book's table of contents: it makes lookups fast but adds overhead to writes.
Overfitting in ML means your model memorized training answers instead of learning patterns. Regularization is the cure.
Blue-Green deployment lets you switch production traffic instantly with zero downtime and a clean rollback path.
Git was designed to handle the Linux kernel codebase: millions of files, thousands of contributors, zero central server required.
The CAP Theorem says a distributed system can guarantee at most two of: Consistency, Availability, Partition tolerance.
JSON was invented by Douglas Crockford in 2001 as a lightweight alternative to XML. It is now the de facto web data format.
AES-256-GCM is authenticated encryption: it provides both confidentiality and integrity in a single pass.
A SQL injection attack occurs when unsanitized user input is executed as SQL. Parameterized queries prevent it.
Docker containers share the host OS kernel, making them far lighter than VMs (which virtualize the entire OS).
React's virtual DOM diffs changes before touching real DOM, cutting unnecessary repaints and boosting UI performance.
HTTPS uses TLS, which performs a handshake to establish a symmetric session key via asymmetric cryptography.
The Unix philosophy: write programs that do one thing well, write programs to work together, write programs that handle text streams.
TCP guarantees delivery and order; UDP does not — but UDP is faster, making it preferred for video, gaming, and DNS.
A well-written README is the single highest-leverage documentation investment for any open-source project.
Rubber duck debugging works because explaining code aloud forces you to articulate each assumption — bugs hide in assumptions.
The Twelve-Factor App methodology (Heroku, 2011) defines stateless processes, config via env vars, and disposability as core principles.
